page.title: 06Upper Clatford trade
page.content: {The village shop}is owned by Mr. Don Cullip, a very popular man in the village. Four people work there and they sell groceries, fruit and vegetables, meat, hardware, medicines, wool, seeds, wine and toys. They are open from 7am. to 7pm. daily except on Sunday when they open at lunchtime only. {The Post Office}was once a shop too. Today Mrs. Burgess only sells birthday cards and post cards. She also takes bookings for the Memorial Hall. Mr. Mason owns{Bury Hill Farm}in the middle of the village. He has 240 acres and grows wheat and barley. He also keeps 40 chickens and 4 horses.At the time of the survey he was selling strawberries (50p per lb), raspberries (50p per lb), and eggs (80p per dozen) to callers at the farm.
